content.description: A second pitch to Nowhere Man, the crux of this climb is at the start and involves some delicate climbing right off a ledge. If you fall before clipping the first bolt, you're looking at a bad fall on the belay as the anchors are down and to the right of the start. Overall, a really good climb and worth doing if you are solid at the grade.
content.protection:
Bolts, bolted anchors.

Rappel with a 70m or two ropes.
content.location: An optional second pitch to Nowhere Man / Crack to Nowhere

content.description: Climb the buttress just right of Nowhere Man. A must-do, well protected route on great rock.
content.protection:
Bolts. Bolted anchors.

A 70m rope barely reaches the ground. Otherwise two raps with a 60m can get you down safely.
content.location: Just right of Nowhere Man. Climb Nowhere Man or Carpet Crawl to reach a ledge with bolted anchors and the start of the route.

content.description: Technical and sustained, and maybe a bit runout in sections, this is a must-do for the area. The crux is down low but the climbing stays interesting the entire way.
content.protection:
Bolts. Bolted anchor

Rappel with a 70m (barely reaches) or two ropes.
content.location: This is the third bolted line on the wall when approaching from the Rusty Nail area, right next to Crack to Nowhere

content.description:
P1. Begin by climbing the crack (Pedestal Crack, 5.6) to the top of the pillar. Step onto the face and follow the bolts, trending up and left to a bolted belay. Getting through the first couple of bolts is the crux of the climb. 5.10c/d

P2. Continue up the face, passing 4 bolts, to a set of bolted anchors. 5.10b
content.protection: Single rack with cams to 3/4". Bolts, Bolted anchors
content.location:
This climb is located at the rightmost end of the Nowhere Man area. Locate the large pillar with an obvious crack running up through the middle.

To descend, rappel with two ropes or perform two single rope rappels with a 70m rope

content.description:
A bit harder and more runout than its neighbors

Crack to Nowhere

and

Nowhere Man

, but just as good. Don’t let the grade intimidate you!

Perform a difficult move off the deck to gain good crimps and a stance to clip the high first bolt. From here on, continue following positive crimps and edges to a pair of bolted anchors.
content.protection: Bolts. Bolted Anchors. A 70m rope will barely reach the ground.
content.location: Man-O-Man is the first bolted line on the wall (from north to south.)

content.description: A fun, interesting climb. Sustained and a bit run-out in sections. Climb the line of bolts to a ledge with bolted anchors.
content.protection:
10 bolts. Bolted anchors.

Shares anchors with Nowhere Man.
content.location:
About 20ft left of Carpet Crawl (The large left facing corner.)

A single rappel with a 70m rope barely reaches the ground.

content.description:
P1. Climb up the face and the obvious corner, performing cool moves on thin edges. Continue up to a ramp, traversing left, and then climb up a short face past a small roof to bolted anchors. (5.11-)

P2. Move up and left following the line of bolts to a large ledge with bolted anchors. (5.10 c/d)

P2 Variation. Instead of going left, move up and right and follow the alternate line of bolts to the large ledge with bolted anchors. This pitch is somewhat run-out, but much easier. (5.9)

Descend by performing to 2 single rope rappels to the ground. A 70m rope will reach.
content.location: Locate the obvious right facing corner, just right of Carpet Crawl.
